nodes.text: Zaffa oil was a cooking oil that could be used in baked foodstuffs to give it a citrus kick. In 3 ABY, Devaronian chef Torro Sbazzle cooked for Darth Vader at Baron Administrator Lando Calrissian's request following Vader's arrival in Cloud City. Presuming that Darth Vader was human like most of the Galactic Empire, Sbazzle chose dumplings as one of the dishes. She considered using bantha butter instead of zaffa oil as it was less likely to burn and the resulting dish would be more bland, then she decided to use the oil instead for what she knew could be the last meal she ever cooked.

In the Star Wars Legends continuity, zaffa oil was first mentioned in the story "A Very Special Meal" by Peter M. Schweighofer in the the  Shadows of the Empire Sourcebook. It was introduced to the new canon in "But What Does He Eat?," a short story by S.A. Chakraborty published in the 2020 anthology book From a Certain Point of View: The Empire Strikes Back. The anthology adapts the events of the 1980 original trilogy film, Star Wars: Episode V The Empire Strikes Back.
